message.content:
cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.DB, cs.CC 

This paper deals with the decidability of termination for two dialects of Constraint Handling Rules (CHR), which is a programming language used for constraint solving and rule-based programming. Therefore, cs.PL (Programming Languages) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves logical reasoning and proof techniques, which suggests cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) as another likely sub-category. The use of CHR for constraint solving and rule-based programming also relates to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DB (Databases). Finally, the paper involves complexity analysis and decidability, which suggests cs.CC (Computational Complexity) as a possible sub-category.
